title: How to Make Apple Pie Syrup

steps.headline: Mix together all of the sugar with the cinnamon and nutmeg in the medium sized bowl.
Then fill one of the large pots halfway with cider and pour in the apple juice to fill the pot three-fourths up, measuring from the bottom of the pot.
steps.description: It's okay to eyeball the amount during the pouring process.

steps.headline: Next, pour in all of the sugar mixture and use the stirring spoon to blend it in
Bring the pot to a rolling boil on high heat wile stirring occasionally.
Once it’s boiling, lower to its lowest level and let it cook, with the lid on and cracked at the top, until the water level has dropped back to the one-fourth point.
After it drops, refill the pot up to the halfway point using the apple cider.
Then add in more apple juice to the three-fourth point and stir with the spoon until it’s well-blended again.
steps.description: You will repeat this until all the apple cider is gone, which could take up to three or four hours.

steps.headline: First is to let the syrup cool for at least three hours and then use the thermometer to take the temperature.
If it’s too hot, let it cool until it’s around one hundred and twenty degrees Fahrenheit so that it is still warm enough to pour into jars.
Use the second pot and put the jars in.
Fill it halfway with tap water and warm the water up on the lowest setting until the water is the same temperature at the syrup.
steps.description: This will keep the glass from cracking from the temperature difference when you pour the syrup in.

steps.headline: Gently pour out the water and use the tongs to take out the jars.
Put the funnel in one of the jars and use the oven mitts to pick up the syrup pot and fill the jar to the top.
steps.description: Do this to rest of the jars until there is none left.

steps.headline: Finally, screw on the lids and put the jars on a counter top to cool overnight.
steps.description: In the morning the apple pie syrup should have a clear, reddish-dark, amber-brown colouring.

steps.headline: If so, you can use it to drizzle over pancakes, waffles, and oatmeal or any other sweat treat your little heart desires.

text: Mix together all of the sugar with the cinnamon and nutmeg in the medium sized bowl.  Then fill one of the large pots halfway with cider and pour in the apple juice to fill the pot three-fourths up, measuring from the bottom of the pot. It's okay to eyeball the amount during the pouring process. Next, pour in all of the sugar mixture and use the stirring spoon to blend it in  Bring the pot to a rolling boil on high heat wile stirring occasionally.  Once it’s boiling, lower to its lowest level and let it cook, with the lid on and cracked at the top, until the water level has dropped back to the one-fourth point.  After it drops, refill the pot up to the halfway point using the apple cider.  Then add in more apple juice to the three-fourth point and stir with the spoon until it’s well-blended again. You will repeat this until all the apple cider is gone, which could take up to three or four hours. First is to let the syrup cool for at least three hours and then use the thermometer to take the temperature.  If it’s too hot, let it cool until it’s around one hundred and twenty degrees Fahrenheit so that it is still warm enough to pour into jars.  Use the second pot and put the jars in.  Fill it halfway with tap water and warm the water up on the lowest setting until the water is the same temperature at the syrup. This will keep the glass from cracking from the temperature difference when you pour the syrup in. Gently pour out the water and use the tongs to take out the jars.  Put the funnel in one of the jars and use the oven mitts to pick up the syrup pot and fill the jar to the top. Do this to rest of the jars until there is none left. Finally, screw on the lids and put the jars on a counter top to cool overnight. In the morning the apple pie syrup should have a clear, reddish-dark, amber-brown colouring. If so, you can use it to drizzle over pancakes, waffles, and oatmeal or any other sweat treat your little heart desires. Bacon is highly recommended.
